meanings.definition: The principles of architecture or architectural design.
meanings.sent1: The architectonics of the building focused on symmetry and balance.
meanings.sent2: The architectonics of the cathedral were admired for their intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The architectonics of the treehouse made it look like a miniature castle.
meanings.sent4: The architectonics of the city skyline resembled a futuristic metropolis.
meanings.sent5: The architectonics of the bridge were so elegant that it became a landmark.

meanings.definition: The structure or organization of a system or body of knowledge.
meanings.sent1: The architectonics of the textbook made it easy to follow the chapters.
meanings.sent2: The architectonics of the research paper were clear and logical.
meanings.sent3: The architectonics of the puzzle game challenged players to think strategically.
meanings.sent4: The architectonics of the library catalog simplified the search process.
meanings.sent5: The architectonics of the computer program enhanced its efficiency.

meanings.definition: The study of the overall design or structure of something.
meanings.sent1: Her interest in architectonics led her to analyze the layout of gardens.
meanings.sent2: The course on architectonics explored various design theories.
meanings.sent3: The architectonics of the fashion show impressed the audience with its creativity.
meanings.sent4: The architectonics of the painting revealed the artist's attention to detail.
meanings.sent5: The architectonics of the website influenced user experience significantly.
